definitions.definition: A person who has taken specific lay or monastic vows and who is on the road to perfect knowledge; specifically, one who foregoes personal nirvana in order to help others achieve enlightenment.

An enlightened being existing in a form of existence beyond the ordinary forms of physical reality understood and acknowledged by scientific thought, resembling the Western notion of angels, but with a wealth of its own nuances and expectations. These include the compassionate working for enlightenment of all sentient beings.
Taking place across a border.
Across a border.
A journey by ox wagon.
The Boer migration of 1835-1837.
A slow or difficult journey.
definitions.example: We're planning a trek up Kilimanjaro.

definitions.definition: A long walk.
definitions.example: I would drive to the shops from here; you can walk, but it's quite a trek.

definitions.definition: To make a slow or arduous journey.
To journey on foot, especially to hike through mountainous areas.
To travel by ox wagon.
Not sufferable; very difficult or impossible to endure.
Of, facing, situated in, or related to the north-east
(of a wind) blowing from the north-east; north-easterly
A rank in the RAF, between that of flying officer and squadron leader, of a person in charge of a flight of aircraft, equivalent to a Royal Navy lieutenant or an Army captain
Overly concerned about oneself, to the point of ignoring the feelings of others.
definitions.example: I don't want to call him self-absorbed but he was more concerned with the scratch on his car than the people in the car he hit.

definitions.definition: A children's luck-based board game of Indian origin, played on a numbered grid, the aim of which is to proceed to the end, and in which ladders aid progress and snakes impede it.
Any situation in which people or events go forward and backward, seemingly at random
Intoxicated, inebriated, or otherwise stupefied by an ingested mind-altering substance, typically alcohol; drunk.
definitions.example: He was arrested for driving under the influence.

definitions.definition: A ball, bowled by a leg-break bowler, that spins from off to leg (to a right-handed batsman), unlike a normal leg-break delivery.
(of the eyes) Bulging.
(usually of eyes, sometimes of persons) Appearing to be amorous, flirtatious.
A bird.
A bird of the order Galliformes, including chickens, turkeys, pheasant, partridges and quail.
Birds which are hunted or kept for food, including Galliformes and also waterfowl of the order Anseriformes such as ducks, geese and swans.
To hunt fowl.
definitions.example: We took our guns and went fowling.

definitions.definition: Foul
A round building, usually small, often with a dome
(frequently capitalized) A Gothic typeface used in early printed books in Northern Italy, based on a rounded script developed in the 13th cent.; the manuscript hand on which this typeface was based
A roundabout; a road junction at which traffic streams circularly around a central island.
Body of persons, such as ministers, sheiks, priests and rabbis, who are trained and ordained for religious service.
definitions.example: Today we brought together clergy from the Wiccan, Christian, New Age and Islamic traditions for an interfaith dialogue.

definitions.definition: To bring something when coming.
definitions.example: Can you bring round some beer when you come tonight?

definitions.definition: To resuscitate; to cause to regain consciousness.
definitions.example: We thought he was going to die, but the doctors managed to bring him round.

definitions.definition: To change someone's opinion or point of view.
definitions.example: She was opposed to the new housing development, but we eventually brought her round.

definitions.definition: An advocate of collectivism.
Of or pertaining to collectivism.
Beefsteak, a slice of beef, broiled or cut for broiling.
(by extension) A relatively large, thick slice or slab cut from another animal, a vegetable, etc.
(seafood) A slice of meat cut across the grain (perpendicular to the spine) from a fish.
To cook (something, especially fish) like or as a steak.
To violently break something into pieces.
definitions.example: The miners used dynamite to shatter rocks.

definitions.definition: To destroy or disable something.
To smash, or break into tiny pieces.
To dispirit or emotionally defeat
definitions.example: to be shattered in intellect; to have shattered hopes, or a shattered constitution

definitions.definition: To scatter about.
Physically broken into pieces
Emotionally defeated or dispirited
Extremely tired or exhausted
definitions.example: I stayed up all night working, and now I'm completely shattered.

definitions.definition: An inquiry into the financial position of a person applying for some form of financial assistance in order to determine their eligibility.
To apply a means test to an individual or group.
Suggestive or characteristic of winter; cold, stormy.
definitions.example: wintry weather

definitions.definition: Of precipitation, containing sleet or snow.
definitions.example: It will be cloudy overnight, with outbreaks of heavy rain at times. The rain may turn wintry over higher ground.

definitions.definition: Aged, white-haired.
Chilling, cheerless.
definitions.example: a wintry remark

definitions.definition: A small falcon, Falco sparverius, the American kestrel or American sparrowhawk, that preys on grasshoppers and small animals, which is found in North and South America.
The Eurasian sparrowhawk, Accipiter nisus, a small, short-winged European hawk that preys on smaller birds.
A female such bird, a male being a musket.
Any of numerous other species of Accipiter, that prey on smaller birds or otherwise resemble A. nisus.
A situation where if one of the two players wins the next point, (s)he will win the set (but not the match).
A setting or location that is fixed.
An act of misfiring.
To fail to discharge properly.
(of an engine) To fail to ignite in the proper sequence.
(by extension) To fail to achieve the anticipated result.
definitions.example: His practical joke misfired and he nearly burnt my left hand.

definitions.definition: A seat in a motor car.
A detachable motor car seat equipped with a harness to secure a young child.
A whiskey distilled from a mixture of grains in which at least 51% is corn, aged in charred, new oak barrels. Made in the United States.
A serving of bourbon whiskey.
A Bourbon biscuit.
Land that is suitable for farming and agricultural production.
A medicine for suppressing spasms.
Of or relating to a spasm; resembling a sudden contraction of the muscles.
Convulsive; consisting of spasms.
definitions.example: spasmodic asthma

definitions.definition: Intermittent or fitful; occurring in abrupt bursts.
definitions.example: spasmodic zeal or industry

definitions.definition: Erratic or unsustained.
Of or relating to the spasmodic poets, a group of British Victorian poets who wrote introspective drama in verse.
Following as a result.
Having significant consequences; of importance.
Important or significant.
(of a person) Self-important.
A large piece of machinery that digs holes or trenches; an excavator.
A tool for digging.
A spade (playing card).
One who digs.
A gold miner, one who digs for gold.
An informal nickname for a friend; used as a term of endearment.
An Australian soldier.
A dark brownish-grey colour, the colour of moleskin.
Of a dark brownish-grey colour.
A hole drilled into the earth from which petroleum is pumped.
A curtain; a drapery.
The way in which fabric falls or hangs.
A member of a youth subculture distinguished by its sharp dress, especially peg-leg pants (1950s: e.g. Baltimore, MD). Antonym: square
A dress made from an entire piece of cloth, without having pieces cut away as in a fitted garment.
To cover or adorn with drapery or folds of cloth, or as with drapery
definitions.example: to drape a bust, a building, etc.

definitions.definition: To spread over, cover.
definitions.example: I draped my towel over the radiator to dry.

definitions.definition: To rail at; to banter.
To make cloth.
To design drapery, arrange its folds, etc., as for hangings, costumes, statues, etc.
To hang or rest limply
A person who supplies or designs costumes.
Any of various large species of deer such as the red deer, moose or wapiti (see usage notes).
The European wild, whistling, or common swan (Cygnus cygnus, syn. Cygnus ferus).
A sudden heavy rainstorm.
A song, often sentimental, lamenting an unrequited love; normally sung by a woman.
A trial or practice run of a piece of equipment in its intended usage environment to check for errors before final deployment.
A test which assesses the performance of an engine or vehicle on the road.
A driving test.
Mizzenmast.
A fore-and-aft sail set on a mizzenmast.
Hindmost; nearest the stern.
definitions.example: the mizzen shrouds, sails, etc.

definitions.definition: A form of massage, using the thumbs and palms, employed as therapy.
A mechanic, often with the specific connotation of an automobile mechanic.
To work; to be successful; to solve a problem; to be sufficient or adequate to fulfill a purpose.
A light blow or jolting collision.
The sound of such a collision.
A protuberance on a level surface.
A swelling on the skin caused by illness or injury.
One of the protuberances on the cranium which, in phrenology, are associated with distinct faculties or affections of the mind. Also (metonymically) the faculty itself
definitions.example: the bump of veneration; the bump of acquisitiveness

definitions.definition: The point, in a race in which boats are spaced apart at the start, at which a boat begins to overtake the boat ahead.
The swollen abdomen of a pregnant woman.
A post in an Internet forum thread made in order to raise the thread's profile by returning it to the top of the list of active threads.
A temporary increase in a quantity, as shown in a graph.
definitions.example: US presidential nominees get a post-convention bump in survey ratings.

definitions.definition: A dose of a drug such as ketamine or cocaine, when snorted recreationally.
The noise made by the bittern; a boom.
(preceded by definite article) A disco dance in which partners rhythmically bump each other's hips together.
In skipping, a single jump over two consecutive turns of the rope.
A coarse cotton fabric.
A training match for a fighting dog.
The jaw of either of the middle pockets.
Music, especially played over speakers at loud volume with strong bass frequency response.
To knock against or run into with a jolt.
To move up or down by a step; displace.
definitions.example: I bumped the font size up to make my document easier to read.

definitions.definition: To post in an Internet forum thread in order to raise the thread's profile by returning it to the top of the list of active threads.
(of a superheated liquid) To suddenly boil, causing movement of the vessel and loss of liquid.
To move (a booked passenger) to a later flight because of earlier delays or cancellations.
To move the time of (a scheduled event).
To pick (a lock) with a repeated striking motion that dislodges the pins.
To make a loud, heavy, or hollow noise; to boom.
To spread out material so as to fill any desired number of pages.
To apply ink to; to cover or smear with ink.
To sign (a contract or similar document).
To apply a tattoo to (someone).
(of a squid or octopus) to eject ink (sense 3)
An application of ink.
Work done by an inker, one kind of commercial artist
Inputting text or drawings into a computer, tablet, or similar apparatus using a stylus.
A defensive activity where ink is released by squids, cuttlefish, etc.
An inn or place of call midway on a journey.
A temporary residence for those who have left prison, residential drug rehabilitation or the like, designed to ease them back into society.
A social and economic class lying above the lower class and below the upper middle class.
A device, generally constructed from fabric, that is designed to employ air resistance to control the fall of an object.
A web or fold of skin extending between the legs of gliding mammals, such as the flying squirrel and colugo.
(BDSM) A small collar which fastens around the scrotum and from which weights can be hung.
To jump, fall, descend, etc. using such a device.
To introduce into a place using such a device.
definitions.example: The soldiers were parachuted behind enemy lines.

definitions.definition: To place (somebody) in an organisation in a position of authority without their having previous experience there; used with in or into.
A pheasant of the genus Pavo or Afropavo, notable for the extravagant tails of the males; a peacock (unspecified sex).
Someone who owns a ship.
A cushion or stiff material placed on top of a table, underneath a tablecloth.
definitions.example: After putting the leaves in the table and putting on the tablemat and tablecloth, they laid the placemats out.

definitions.definition: A paste, normally used with a toothbrush, for cleaning the teeth.
To thrust into liquid, or into any penetrable substance; to immerse.
definitions.example: to plunge the body into water

definitions.definition: To cast, stab or throw into some thing, state, condition or action.
definitions.example: to plunge a dagger into the breast;   to plunge a nation into war

definitions.definition: To baptize by immersion.
To dive, leap or rush (into water or some liquid); to submerge oneself.
definitions.example: he plunged into the river

definitions.definition: To fall or rush headlong into some thing, action, state or condition.
definitions.example: to plunge into debt;   to plunge into controversy

definitions.definition: To pitch or throw oneself headlong or violently forward, as a horse does.
To bet heavily and recklessly; to risk large sums in gambling.
To entangle or embarrass (mostly used in past participle).
To overwhelm, overpower.
An occurrence of putting or sinking under water or other fluid.
A headlong violent motion like that of a horse trying to throw its rider.
That descends steeply.
Aimed from higher ground, as fire upon an enemy.
Not fixed in any way to a surface. Relying solely on the force of gravity to stay in place
That stands alone, not supported at either side
Independent, autonomous
The more right-wing faction of a group or party.
The right-hand side of a sports field.
The offensive player who plays to the center's right.
A job taken by a student in order to learn a profession or trade.
A kind of scoop or ladle, chiefly used to remove the scum from brine-pans in saltworks.
The act of plundering.
definitions.example: the loot of an ancient city

definitions.definition: Plunder, booty, especially from a ransacked city.
Any prize or profit received for free, especially Christmas presents
definitions.example: 1956 "Free Loot for Children" (LIFE Magazine, 23 April 1956, p. 131)

definitions.definition: Items dropped by defeated enemies.
To steal, especially as part of war, riot or other group violence.
definitions.example: 1833 "Gunganarian, the leader of the Chooars, continues his system of looting and murder", The asiatic Journal and monthly register for British India and its Dependencies Black, Parbury & Allen, p. 66.

definitions.definition: To steal from.
definitions.example: to loot a temple for valuables

definitions.definition: To examine the corpse of a fallen enemy for loot.
To encourage into action.
To arouse an organism to functional activity.
Having a manner that stimulates.

(grammar, usually plural) Any of the forms of a word which contain its stem(s) in the simplest form, or such a form that, when taken with all the other principal parts, allows the entire paradigm to be derived.

A polynomial approximation of a power series, made up of monomials whose indices lie in the Newton diagram of the power series and which occur with the same coefficients as in the original power series.
The portion of a Laurent series that has negative exponents.
An encounter; a scrape or brush, especially one involving trouble or difficulty.
The end-phase of a competition.
definitions.example: Yahoo Sport's Leicester City blogger Helen Nutter gets ready for the Premier League run-in knowing her side - incredibly - still have a great chance of being crowned champions

definitions.definition: A very large, heavy, or impressive person.
definitions.example: an intellectual heavyweight

definitions.definition: The professional boxing weight class for boxers weighing more than 190 pounds; a boxer in that division.
(uncountable) A similar division and contestant in other sports.
Of the heavyweight boxing (or similar) division.
Being relatively heavy.
Being a leader in one's field.
Important or impressive.
A dry leavening agent used in baking; a mixture of baking soda, an acid (often cream of tartar) and starch to keep it dry; when wetted, carbon dioxide is released.
A close fitting, insulating garment usually made from neoprene or similar material designed to keep one warm during activities on or under water.
A device, usually hinged with a striking plate, used for knocking on a door.
A person who knocks.
A critic; one who disparages.
A person who knocks (denigrates) something.
(usually in the plural) A woman's breasts.
(especially Cardigan) A dwarf, goblin, or sprite imagined to dwell in mines and to indicate the presence of ore by knocking.
A mechanical device in a pinball table that produces a loud percussive noise.
A person who is strikingly handsome or otherwise admirable; a stunner.
A large cockroach, especially Blaberus giganteus, of semitropical America, which is able to produce a loud knocking sound.
A large, boulder-shaped outcrop of bedrock in an otherwise low-lying landscape, chiefly associated with a mélange.
One who defaults on payment of a wager.
The side of a road vehicle nearest to the kerb: the left side if one drives on the left of the road.
The face of the Moon nearest the Earth.
A streetcar designed to discharge passengers on the near side of an intersection, rather than the far side.
An event in which an employer bars employees from working as a tactic in negotiating terms of employment, particularly in response to a strike or threat to strike.
To inadvertently prevent (a person, particularly oneself) from entering a place, by leaving it locked.
definitions.example: I've locked myself out of my room again!

definitions.definition: To prevent from accessing a data structure.
The quality of being contingent, of happening by chance; unpredictability.
A possibility; something which may or may not happen. A chance occurrence, especially in finance, unexpected expenses.

An amount of money which a party to a contract has to pay to the other party (usually the supplier of a major project to the client) if he or she does not fulfill the contract according to the specification.
A statement which is neither a tautology nor a contradiction.
A refreshing drink flavored with aromatic herbs, especially mint, and sometimes alcohol.
A pleasant-tasting liquid medicine in which other nauseous medicines are taken.
A plant of the genus Iris, common in the northern hemisphere, and generally having attractive blooms (See Iris (plant)).
The contractile membrane perforated by the pupil, which adjusts to control the amount of light reaching the retina, and which forms the colored portion of the eye (See Iris (anatomy)).
A diaphragm used to regulate the size of a hole, especially as a way of controlling the amount of light reaching a lens.
A rainbow, or other colourful refraction of light.
A constricted opening in the path inside a waveguide, used to form a resonator.
The inner circle of an oscillated color spot.
(of an aperture, lens or door) To open or close in the manner of an iris.
Transparent or translucent; that can be seen through
definitions.example: If you are planning to wear a see-through dress, wear something underneath.

definitions.definition: An eruptive rock, one produced by eruption.
That erupts or bursts forth.
Accompanied by eruptions.
definitions.example: an eruptive fever

definitions.definition: Produced by eruption.
definitions.example: eruptive rocks, such as the igneous or volcanic

definitions.definition: To reduce the offer price of a property after agreeing to a higher one (normally just before contracts are exchanged)
Tough; having strong sinews.
Having or showing nervous strength.
(of a person or animal) Possessing physical strength and weight; rugged and powerful.
The act, process, or result of cancelling; as, the cancellation of certain words in a contract, or of the contract itself.
The operation of striking out common factors, in both the dividend and divisor.
A postmark that marks a postage stamp so as to prevent its reuse.
In United States intellectual property law, a proceeding in which an interested party seeks to cancel the registration of a trademark or patent.
The property of being cancellate.
To make an area or a thing clean; to pick up a mess; to tidy.
definitions.example: Clean up your room.

definitions.definition: To become clean, handsome, smart in appearance, e.g. for a special occasion, especially when it is out of character to be seen as such.
definitions.example: He sure cleans up nice.

definitions.definition: To make a large profit; to win by a large margin, or to win a large amount, especially in gambling. Also clean house.
definitions.example: Man, he sure cleaned up last night at the blackjack table.   The investors cleaned up when the stock hit the roof last year.

definitions.definition: The act of cleaning or tidying something.
Fourth in the batting order; a cleanup hitter.
definitions.example: Jones will be batting cleanup in tonight's game.

definitions.definition: The conduct of a lawsuit.
definitions.example: That attorney has been chastised for his litigation behavior.

definitions.definition: A pain in the middle or inner ear.
To cause to burn.
To cause inflammation; to inflame.
To open outward in shape.
definitions.example: The building flared from the third through the seventh floors to occupy the airspace over the entrance plaza. (intransitive)

definitions.definition: To (operate an aircraft to) transition from downward flight to level flight just before landing.
To blaze brightly.
definitions.example: The blast furnace flared in the night.

definitions.definition: To shine out with a sudden and unsteady light; to emit a dazzling or painfully bright light.
definitions.example: The candle flared in a sudden draught.

definitions.definition: To shine out with gaudy colours; to be offensively bright or showy.
To suddenly happen or intensify.
To suddenly erupt in anger.
To be exposed to too much light.
The pelt of a bear, especially when used as a rug.
A tall ceremonial hat worn by members of some British regiments for ceremonial occasions; a busby.
A coarse, shaggy, woollen cloth for overcoats.
Inflammation of the vermiform appendix
A stone slab set at the head of a grave.
(now specifically) Human and animal solid waste excreted from the bowels; feces.
Any waste matter excreted from the human or animal body, or discharged by bodily organs.
Something which grows out of the body; hair, nails etc.
A three-dimensional image of an object created by holography.
An underwater vane used to steer a vessel. The rudder is controlled by means of a wheel, tiller or other apparatus (modern vessels can be controlled even with a joystick or an autopilot).

A control surface on the vertical stabilizer of a fixed-wing aircraft or an autogyro. On some craft, the entire vertical stabilizer comprises the rudder. The rudder is controlled by foot-operated control pedals.
A riddle or sieve.
That which resembles a rudder as a guide or governor; that which guides or governs the course.
A cave or cavern.
An underground vault, especially one beneath a church that is used as a burial place.
A small pit or cavity in the surface of an organ or other structure.
A contorted facial expression, often expressing contempt or pain.
Affectation, pretence.
To make grimaces; to distort one's face; to make faces.
The member of staff at a restaurant who keeps the wine cellar, advises guests on the choice of wines and serves them.
A cot; a lightweight portable bed used by the military, campers etc.
The missing of both the first serve and second serve, resulting in a point for the receiver.
An exception thrown by the CPU while trying to call the handler of another exception (e.g. the exception handler is invalid or the call stack has overflowed).
A body of forces equipped for war.
All the cannon and small arms collectively, with their equipments, belonging to a ship or a fortification.
Any equipment for resistance.
The process of building up military capacity.
